business.headline: Pulse crisis: Why are prices crashing below MSP despite high demand?Despite this rising import bill, instead of expansion, the area under pulses cultivation has shrunk. Over the past four years, the area under pulses has declined by nearly 3.1 million hectares.

Sensex, Nifty gain for 4th straight session as investors expect strong Q2 earningsThe S&P BSE Sensex slipped 136.63 points to close at 81,926.75, while the NSE Nifty50 ended 30.65 points higher at 25,108.30. Broader market indices also ended the session largely positive, supported by easing volatility and sustained optimism around the upcoming quarterly earnings season.

WeWork India IPO hit by InGovern's concerns over finances days before listingInGovern pointed out that the company has reported negative cash flows for several financial years, suggesting that its operations have yet to generate consistent income.

Not getting benefit of lower prices under GST 2.0? Here's what to doA recent LocalCircles survey that received over 78,000 responses from more than 27,000 people across 332 districts suggested that the benefits of GST 2.0 are reaching consumers unevenly.

World Bank sees India growth at 6.5% for FY26, 6.3% for FY27In its latest South Asia Development Update, the World Bank highlighted that South Asia's overall growth is expected to slow to 5.8% in 2026, down from 6.6% in 2025, with trade disruptions and emerging technologies, including Artificial Intelligence (AI), creating fresh uncertainties for the region.

Why the 50-30-20 budget rule doesn't work for everyone, explains expertThe popular 50-30-20 budgeting rule has guided millions of people for decades. But personal finance expert says it often overlooks individual goals and may leave you short of what you actually need.
Here's how much salary hike employees can expect in 2026According to Aon's Annual Salary Increase and Turnover Survey 2025-26 for India, employees can expect an average salary hike of 9% next year.

New airport drives up real estate prices in Navi MumbaiThe development has already pushed property prices in surrounding areas such as Panvel, Ulwe, and Kharghar, as investors and developers rush to capitalise on the opportunities the airport promises.

UPI to introduce facial and fingerprint authentication soon: ReportUPI is set to allow users to authenticate transactions using facial recognition and fingerprints, according to sources. This new feature is expected to go live soon.

Pension hike after 11 years? All-important EPFO meeting to decide soonAfter more than a decade, pensioners may finally get some relief. The EPFO is set to discuss raising the minimum pension under EPS-95 during its upcoming board meeting in Bengaluru on October 10–11.

LG Electronics IPO: GMP hints at strong listing, but is it really a good bet?Early signals from the market suggest strong demand. The Grey Market Premium, for instance, is reported at Rs 318, implying a potential listing price of around Rs 1,458 per share, roughly 28% above the upper end of the price band.
Gold prices hit another record high: Invest now or wait?With gold hitting new all-time highs, investors are asking: should I buy now, or wait for prices to stabilise?

Out of stock: How GST rate cuts have left companies scrambling for supplyLarge-screen televisions and premium mobile phones have gone out of stock in many parts of the country as manufacturers misjudged the post-GST demand surge.
Tata Capital IPO Day 2: Check GMP, subscription status and moreThe Tata Capital IPO is set to close on Wednesday, October 8, with allotment scheduled for October 9 and listing on October 13.

ITR processed but tax refund still pending? Here's what you should doMany taxpayers are finding themselves in a fix this year; their Income Tax Returns (ITRs) show "processed", but the refund hasn't reached their bank accounts yet. If you're one of them, here's what might be causing the delay and what you can do about it.

Is the auto sector rally over for now? Analysts bet on these sectors nextThe latest report from the Federation of Automobile Dealers Associations (FADA) shows historic sales during Navratri, backed by strong demand and the recent GST rationalisation. However, analysts believe that while the short-term growth looks impressive, the auto rally may soon stabilise as pent-up demand fades.

Sensex jumps 400 points: 3 factors behind today's rally on Dalal StreetMarket analysts pointed to a combination of factors driving the rally—upbeat Q2 updates from large-cap firms, an early pick-up in festive season spending, and improved GST collections reflecting resilient consumption.
Sensex opens 140 points higher, Nifty above 25,100; Power Grid up 1%The S&P BSE Sensex added 215.94 points to 82,006.06, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 64.90 points to 25,142.55, as of 9:38 am.

LG Electronics IPO opens today: Check GMP, price band, and should you subscribe?The company has set a price band of Rs 1,080–Rs 1,140 per share for the offer, which comprises an offer for sale (OFS) worth Rs 11,600 crore, representing a 15% stake divestment by the South Korean parent, LG Electronics Inc.

LG Electronics IPO: The good, the bad, and what investors should knowIncorporated in 1997, LG Electronics India Ltd is one of the country's largest manufacturers and distributors of home appliances and consumer electronics.

entertainment.headline: Lee Chae Min defends Ryu Da In from online hate post-Bon Appetit fame South Korean actor Lee Chae Min addresses online criticism of his girlfriend, Ryu Da In, following increased attention from his drama. The couple was recently seen on a public date, demonstrating the stability of their relationship.

Exclusive: Kantara's Rishab Shetty asks fans to not dress as Daiva, stop mockery Actor Rishab Shetty has requested fans of 'Kantara' not to dress up as Daiva while watching the film in theatres. Calling it a sacred tradition, the 'Kantara Chapter 1' star said such acts hurt community sentiments and distort the spiritual essence behind the story.

Pradeep Ranganathan's LIK avoids clash with Dude on Diwali, new release date out Actor-director Pradeep Ranganathan's 'Love Insurance Kompany' has been delayed from October release to December. The move allows his film 'Dude' to release on October 17 during Diwali.

1 month into Rise & Fall: Contestants ranked from top to bottom It's been a month since 'Rise & Fall' kicked off, and what a ride it's been. From fiery clashes to unexpected friendships, the game's dynamics have completely turned. With only ten contestants left, let's see who's calling the shots and who's barely hanging on.

Tara Sutaria shares glimpses of her romantic Italian getaway with Veer Pahariya Tara Sutaria has gone Instagram official with boyfriend Veer Pahariya, sharing stunning photos from their romantic Amalfi Coast getaway. The couple's stylish holiday highlights their chemistry while keeping fans excited about their blossoming relationship.

Akshay Kumar pledges better footwear for Mumbai police to improve health Actor Akshay Kumar has offered to help redesign shoes for the Maharashtra Police after highlighting the health impact of current footwear. The initiative could improve officers' well-being and their responsiveness on duty.

Hate to break it to you, but The Life of a Showgirl is peak Taylor Swift Taylor Swift's 'The Life of a Showgirl' faces unfair hate despite record-breaking success. Here's why it's one of her most fearless, fun, and powerful eras yet.

Mohanlal meets Army Chief in Delhi, receives commendation for Dadasaheb Phalke win Actor Mohanlal met with the Army Chief in Delhi and received a commendation. The actor shared his appreciation for the Army and discussed ways to enhance the Territorial Army battalion.

Rishab Shetty's Kantara shows indigenous cultures and their struggle for survival Rishab Shetty's 'Kantara: Chapter 1' beautifully captures the lives, faith, and traditions of India's indigenous communities while highlighting their struggle to protect their land, culture, and dignity. The film serves as a tribute to their deep bond with nature and their fight against exploitation in a changing world.

Bobby praises Ranbir for making Animal role powerful: Wouldn't have done without him Bobby Deol earned widespread praise for his brief but impactful role as Abrar Haque in 'Animal', yet he humbly credited Ranbir Kapoor's performance for the character's success. He emphasised the importance of a strong hero-antagonist dynamic and confirmed the story will continue in the upcoming sequel 'Animal Park'.

Rishab Shetty: Edited 90 per cent of Kantara Chapter 1 in our village In an exclusive interview with India Today, Rishab Shetty spoke about how he made 'Kantara: Chapter 1' in his own village, including completing nearly 90% of the post-production work there.

Is Rishab's Kantara Chapter 1 still a Rs 1,000 crore contender? Experts weigh in Ahead of its release on October 2, Rishab Shetty's 'Kantara: Chapter 1' was considered as the last Rs 1,000 crore hope for Indian cinema in 2025. With Rs 300 crore in its bag and positive word-of-mouth, trade experts discuss if the film will reach the magic mark.

Kantara: Chapter 1 fame Rukmini Vasanth opens up on playing grounded character Actor Rukmini Vasanth, who portrays actor-director Rishab Shetty's love-interest in 'Kantara: Chapter 1', reflected on the portrayal of women in the film. In an exclusive interview with India Today, she shared her on-screen transformation for the period action-thriller.

KBC 17: Amitabh Bachchan gets called Bhoot Uncle from junior contestant Purav Junior contestant Purav from Kolkata referred to Amitabh Bachchan as 'Bhoot Uncle' on 'Kaun Banega Crorepati 17'. Amitabh Bachchan responded to the playful exchange by referencing his film role in 'Bhootnath'.

Bigg Boss Kannada 12 to be shut after pollution control board flags violation The Karnataka State Pollution Control Board has halted 'Bigg Boss Kannada 12' filming and ordered for its immediate closure after finding multiple environmental violations at the Bidadi studio site.

Triptii Dimri appreciates Deepika Padukone's work amid Spirit casting changes After 'Spirit' casting controversy, Triptii Dimri's quiet gesture of liking a post praising Deepika Padukone sparked a widespread discussion online.

Vice Principals star Kimberly Hebert Gregory dies at 52 Kimberly Hebert Gregory, best known for her role as Dr Belinda Brown in HBO's 'Vice Principals', has died at the age of 52, leaving behind a rich legacy in television, film, and theatre.

Rishab Shetty's wife shares emotional note on Kantara Chapter 1 with BTS pics Pragathi Rishab Shetty, wife of actor-director Rishab Shetty and costume designer for 'Kantara' and 'Kantara Chapter 1', shared a heartfelt note and shared some behin- the-scenes pictures from the sets of the recent blockbuster.

Why Salman Khan's soft spot for Amaal Mallik is making Bigg Boss 19 hard to watch Salman Khan's perceived bias towards Amaal Mallik during 'Bigg Boss 19' sparked widespread criticism. Fans question the fairness of the show's editing and hosting decisions.

general news.headline: Dealulu: Trump's Gaza plan is a suicide note disguised as a peace accordHamas, the only Palestinian party to the deal has to erase itself. The other, the Palestinian Authority, has to reform itself while Israel will decide when the IDF will vacate Gaza. In the grand tradition of diplomatic doodles, this is less a treaty and more a suicide pact wrapped in gold leaf. It is not ordained to fail, it's pure-ordained to fail.
Top Haryana cop dies by suicide, shoots himself at Chandigarh residence2001-batch IPS officer allegedly shot himself with service revolver in the basement of his Sector 11 house.

No big brother, BJP and JDU likely to contest equal number of seats in BiharBihar assembly election dates were announced on Monday, with the state set to vote in two phases on November 6 and 11, with results on November 14. Over 7.4 crore voters, including first-time and female voters, will decide a high-stakes contest involving the NDA, Mahagathbandhan, and Jan Suraaj party.

SIR prerogative of poll body, directive to them is interference: Supreme CourtConducting the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) in poll-bound Bihar is the Election Commission's prerogative and issuing any directive to them will be an interference, the Supreme Court said.

How 2025 Physics Nobel winners power our phones and computersThis award "celebrates the way that century-old quantum mechanics continually offers new surprises," Nobel Committee chair Olle Eriksson remarked.

On social media these days...: CJI Gavai quips amid Lord Vishnu remark rowChief Justice BR Gavai's courtroom witnessed a light-hearted exchange on Tuesday just a day after dramatic scenes played out as a lawyer attempted to throw a shoe at him.

Why motel business is getting Gujaratis killed in USThree Gujarati people linked to the motel business were killed last week in Pennsylvania and North Carolina in two separate incidents. In all, seven Gujarat-origin people have been killed in motel crimes across the US this year. Gujaratis own 60% of the motel business in the US. Why is the motel business so risky, and how are Gujaratis coming in harm's way?

Dhravya Shah leaves IIT prep to launch AI startup, raises $3 million19-year-old Mumbai-born Dhravya Shah has turned heads in Silicon Valley after his AI startup, Supermemory, secured $3 million in seed funding from Google executives.

Video: Crocodile drags woman into river in Odisha, locals watch in horrorForest and fire service teams have launched a search operation, while officials have urged locals to stay away from the river amid reports of recurring crocodile sightings.

Bigg Boss Kannada 12 to be shut after pollution control board flags violationThe Karnataka State Pollution Control Board has halted 'Bigg Boss Kannada 12' filming and ordered for its immediate closure after finding multiple environmental violations at the Bidadi studio site.

No dirty business in Air India crash probe: Aviation minister allays concernsResponding to questions on the preliminary report issued by the Aircraft Accident Investigation Bureau (AAIB), Union Civil Aviation Minister K Rammohan Naidu said the investigation was "transparent, independent, and not influenced by anyone."

Is Israel anywhere close to destroying Hamas 2 years on?Two years after Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu vowed to "wipe out" Hamas following the October 7 massacre, the Gaza-based terror group remains battered but breathing. While US President Donald Trump has a Gaza peace plan, how close is Israel to fulfilling its vow of a total victory? And how has Hamas managed to stay alive?

Is India's thali driving diabetes, obesity? What an ideal Indian plate should beA recent ICMR study highlights India's high carbohydrate consumption as a critical reason for the diabetes and obesity crisis.

After bitter legal fight, Arvind Kejriwal scores sprawling government bungalowAfter repeated interventions by the Delhi High Court, central agencies eventually identified 95 Lodhi Estate for AAP chief and former Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal.

Sanctioned mass rape of 400,000: India flips script as Pak rakes up KashmirDuring a debate on women and security at the United Nations, India tore into Pakistan over its continuing 'delusional tirades', particularly regarding Jammu and Kashmir.

Is Rishab's Kantara Chapter 1 still a Rs 1,000 crore contender? Experts weigh inAhead of its release on October 2, Rishab Shetty's 'Kantara: Chapter 1' was considered as the last Rs 1,000 crore hope for Indian cinema in 2025. With Rs 300 crore in its bag and positive word-of-mouth, trade experts discuss if the film will reach the magic mark.

How the horrors of October 7 turned Gaza into 51 million tonnes of rubbleExactly two years ago, Hamas' brutal attack killed 1,200 Israelis, sparking Israel's devastating retaliation, reducing Gaza to over 50 million tonnes of rubble and leaving 67,000 Palestinians dead. Two years on, deaths, famine, displacement, and the promise of an elusive peace persist.

Accenture spent $2 billion in 3 years... to sack employees!Accenture has reduced its workforce by more than 11,000 employees in the past quarter, spending over $2 billion on severance in recent years as the company undertakes a major restructuring driven by automation and changing industry demands.

I am with you: Vijay video calls each family affected due to Karur stampedeThe stampede, which occurred during Vijay's rally and claimed 41 lives, has caused ripples in Tamil Nadu's political circles ahead of the 2026 assembly polls.
Why the perfect parent image is just toxicTired of seeing parents on social media who seem to have it all together while you feel like you're barely keeping up? That's a toxic trap you need to ditch.

One-third of Silicon Valley is Indian. That's not a flex, it's an escapeBragging that one-third of Silicon Valley tech workers are Indian is no longer impressive. With record placement failures at IITs and a decaying syllabus, it's time we stopped hiding behind diaspora success. Here are six reasons why we strongly believe so.

I don't regret it, says lawyer suspended for shoe attack on Chief Justice GavaiSuspended senior Supreme Court lawyer Rakesh Kishore, 71, who tried to throw a shoe at Chief Justice BR Gavai said that he wasn't drunk and has "no regret" for his act.

INDIA bloc's Bihar seat-sharing talks hit as smaller allies seek bigger pieBihar elections: Mukesh Sahni, who rejoined the Grand Alliance ahead of the 2024 Lok Sabha polls after ditching the NDA, demanded that he be declared the deputy chief ministerial face, sources said.

sports.headline: PAK rolls out free, super-cheap tickets for SA Tests to tackle poor crowds Pakistan Cricket Board has rolled out free and super-affordable tickets for their upcoming two-Test series against South Africa, hoping to revive fan interest. The move comes amid a worrying trend of low turnouts for Test cricket across Asia, including India.

Prithvi Shaw hits daddy hundred vs former team Mumbai before Ranji comeback Out-of-favour India batter made a statement on Tuesday, hitting a daddy hundred for Maharashtra against Mumbai, his former team, in a warm-up match in Pune ahead of the upcoming Ranji Trophy season.

Vaibhav Suryavanshi needs to be fast-tracked like Sachin: Ex-cricketer Rajasthan Royals' director of cricket Zubin Barucha wants Vaibhav Suryavanshi to be fast-tracked to the Indian team. The 14-year-old has been dominating age-group cricket around the world.

Ajith Kumar brings speed and style to Spain, wins Anand Mahindra's praise Ajith Kumar's high-speed test of the Mahindra Formula E car in Spain has won admiration from Anand Mahindra, highlighting the actor's growing passion for motorsports. Balancing a film career with competitive racing, Ajith is now gearing up for more exciting races, including the Asian Le Mans in December.

Fabio Cannavaro named Uzbekistan coach for 2026 World Cup debut Italian World Cup-winning captain Fabio Cannavaro has been appointed as Uzbekistan's national football team head coach, guiding the Central Asian nation into their first-ever FIFA World Cup appearance in 2026. The move signals Uzbekistan's ambition to make a mark on the world stage, bolstered by key players and a globally experienced coaching staff.

Brooke Halliday gutted after NZ's loss to SA: We let Sophie Devine down Brooke Halliday admitted that New Zealand's heavy defeat to South Africa in the Women's World Cup 2025 was especially disappointing as the team failed to support their skipper Sophie Devine. It was only Devine who stood her ground against the Proteas, depsite being in a losing cause.

India's fastest meets the world's fastest: Kujur hangs out with Usain Bolt India's fastest man Animesh Kujur met his hero Usain Bolt in Mumbai. The duo met through a Puma collaboration after Animesh's breakthrough season in Indian athletics.

Without the captain's armband, will Rohit Sharma play differently in ODIs? With Shubman Gill now captain in ODIs, all eyes are on Rohit Sharma. Can he maintain the fearless tempo that defined his captaincy, and will the former skipper be given the freedom to continue the risk-laden approach that brought India success over the past two years?

Women's World Cup: Vizag pitch set to aid struggling India batters A balanced and batting-friendly pitch awaits India's women's cricket team at Vizag. This is expected to boost the confidence of the batters ahead of their matches against South Africa and Australia.

Smriti Mandhana's idea becomes reality: Mithali Raj stand at Vizag stadium The ACA-VDCA Stadium in Visakhapatnam will honour Mithali Raj and Ravi Kalpana by naming stands after them, acknowledging their impact on Indian women's cricket, after a public suggestion by Smriti Mandhana that received backing from Andhra Pradesh IT Minister Nara Lokesh.

It was only Devine who stood her ground against the Proteas, depsite being in a losing cause.

Can he maintain the fearless tempo that defined his captaincy, and will the former skipper be given the freedom to continue the risk-laden approach that brought India success over the past two years?

Smriti Mandhana's idea becomes reality: Mithali Raj stand at Vizag stadium The ACA-VDCA Stadium in Visakhapatnam will honour Mithali Raj and Ravi Kalpana by naming stands after them, acknowledging their impact on Indian women's cricket, after a public suggestion by Smriti Mandhana that received backing from Andhra Pradesh IT Minister Nara Lokesh.

Rishabh Pant eager to make Ranji Trophy comeback after injury break: ReportInjured Rishabh Pant is eager to make his comeback in red ball cricket. If reports are to be believed, then the wicketkeeper-batter wants to make his return in the Ranji Trophy.

Dravid saw it early: When ex-coach backed Shubman Gill for full-time captaincyEntrusted with the reins in two of the three international formats, Shubman Gill's ascent to leadership has unfolded under Gautam Gambhir's watch. Yet, it was Rahul Dravid who first sensed the spark in him as early as 2020–21.

From outcast to leader: New ODI VC Shreyas Iyer finally gets recognitionShreyas Iyer has finally received the recognition he deserves, as the 30-year-old has been named the new vice-captain of the Indian ODI team. Never one to seek the spotlight, Shreyas has quietly gone about his work, letting his performances speak for themselves.

Maxwell, Cummins out as Australia announce ODI squad for India seriesAustralia have announced their 15-member squad for the 3-match ODI series against India. Glenn Maxwell and Pat Cummins have not made it to the team due to respective injuries.

Sanju Samson's selection saga: Talent, versatility on display yet chances go missingDespite a century in his last ODI and strong Asia Cup performances, Sanju Samson remains sidelined from the ODI side. His selection saga raises tough questions about consistency, faith, and the logic behind India's ever-changing plans.

World Cup is the biggest stage for Bangladesh to show talent: Nigar SultanaNigar Sultana feels that the Women's World Cup 2025 is the biggest stage for Bangladesh to show their talent and get big teams to play against them in the coming years. Bangladesh won their first match in the tournament.

We'll look to negate in-form Marufa Akter's swing early on: Charlie DeanEngland's vice-captain admitted that they will be looking to tackle Bangladesh's Marufa Akter's swing early on in their upcoming clash in the Women's World Cup.

Having Nat Sciver-Brunt, Charlotte Edwards feels like a fresh start: Charlie DeanEngland vice-captain Charlie Dean says having Natalie Sciver-Brunt as captain and Charlotte Edwards as coach has brought a "fresh start" to the team, with renewed focus, clarity, and a shared determination to play fearless, detail-driven cricket.

His selection saga raises tough questions about consistency, faith, and the logic behind India's ever-changing plans.

Shaw to face Mumbai in Maharashtra practice match ahead of Ranji TrophyPrithvi Shaw will play against his former Mumbai teammates after moving to Maharashtra, as both teams prepare for the upcoming Ranji Trophy season with a practice match at MCA Stadium, Gahunje. Shardul Thakur leads a Shreyas Iyer-less Mumbai, with Ruturaj Gaikwad and Jalaj Saxena included in the Maharashtra squad.

Marufa Akter can become Bangladesh's greatest pacer ever: Nigar SultanaBangladesh captain Nigar Sultana feels that Marufa Akter can become the greatest pacer produced by the nation. Marufa was in fine form during the first match of the tournament against Pakistan.

Rahul Dravid's son, Anvay set to lead Karnataka in Vinoo Mankad TrophyLike father, like son — that seems to be the story in the Dravid household, as Anvay Dravid, son of legendary India batter Rahul Dravid, is set to lead Karnataka in the upcoming Vinoo Mankad Trophy.

Can't play half games in World Cups: Devine slams New Zealand's poor show in IndoreNew Zealand women's skipper, Sophie Devine, was critical of their showcase in the defeat against South Africa, suggesting that they need to put in their all across all facets of the game to ensure they get their first points on the board.

Tazmin Brits' day in Indore: Breaking Lanning's record, celebration picked by fansSouth Africa Tazmin Brits reacted to breaking Meg Lanning's record and the reason behind her arrow celebration after the win over New Zealand. Brits scored 101 as the Proteas women recorded their first win of the Women's World Cup 2025 on Monday, October 6.

South Africa bounce back with resounding win as New Zealand's woes continueWomen's World Cup: South Africa have their first points on the board as they took a rather resounding win over New Zealand, riding on the back of brilliant performances by the centurion, Tazmin Britz and Nonkululeko Mlaba's four-wicket haul.

Where is the 2024 Ballon d'Or winner?Rodri's persistent injuries have kept him off the field, leaving fans and pundits wondering if and when he will return to the form that made him Europe's elite midfielder.

Gautam Gambhir to host Indian team for dinner ahead of Delhi Test vs West IndiesIndia head coach Gautam Gambhir has invited the entire Indian squad and support staff for dinner ahead of the second Test in Delhi. This sets up as a good chance for the team to unwind ahead of a busy schedule.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
